member.name: IBootOptions.AssignBootImage
member.summary: Sets the data stream that contains the boot image.
member.param: An IStream interface of the data stream that contains the boot image.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
The boot object could not be added to the image.
Value: 0xC0AAB142

member.name: IBootOptions.get_BootImage
member.summary: Retrieves a pointer to the boot image data stream.
member.param: Pointer to the IStream interface associated with the boot image data stream.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IBootOptions.get_Emulation
member.summary: Retrieves the media type that the boot image is intended to emulate.
member.param: Media type that the boot image is intended to emulate. For possible values, see the enumeration type.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IBootOptions.get_ImageSize
member.summary: Retrieves the size of the boot image.
member.param: Size, in bytes, of the boot image.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IBootOptions.get_Manufacturer
member.summary: Retrieves the identifier of the manufacturer of the CD.
member.param: Identifier of the manufacturer of the CD.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IBootOptions.get_PlatformId
member.summary: Retrieves the platform identifier that identifies the operating system architecture that the boot image supports.
member.param: Identifies the operating system architecture that the boot image supports. For possible values, see the enumeration type.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IBootOptions.put_Emulation
member.summary: Sets the media type that the boot image is intended to emulate.
member.param: Media type that the boot image is intended to emulate. For possible values, see the enumeration type. The default value is EmulationNone, which means the BIOS will not emulate any device type or special sector size for the CD during boot from the CD.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
The emulation type requested does not match the boot image size.
Value: 0xC0AAB14A

member.name: IBootOptions.put_Manufacturer
member.summary: Sets an identifier that identifies the manufacturer or developer of the CD.
member.param: Identifier that identifies the manufacturer or developer of the CD. This is an ANSI string that is limited to 24 bytes. The string does not need to include a NULL character; however, you must set unused bytes to 0x00.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
The provided newVal parameter is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AAB101

member.name: IBootOptions.put_PlatformId
member.summary: Sets the platform identifier that identifies the operating system architecture that the boot image supports.
member.param: Identifies the operating system architecture that the boot image supports. For possible values, see the enumeration type. The default value is PlatformX86 for Intel x86–based platforms.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

summary.para: Use this interface to specify the boot image to add to the optical disc. A boot image contains one or more sectors of code used to start the computer.
To create an instance of this interface, call the CoCreateInstance function. Use__uuidof(BootOptions) for the class identifier and __uuidof(IBootOptions) for the interface identifier.
